author: Staff Reporter
text:
(Above) Students waiting to get into the examination hall at Thiruvalluvar Government Girls Higher Secondary School. N. Ramalingam, CEO, and officials of the Education Department inspect the SSLC examination hall at Vivekananda School in Puducherry on Tuesday.— Photos: S.S. Kumar

Seven flying squads formed to prevent malpractices

A total of 14,971 students in Puducherry and 3,039 students in Karaikal appeared for the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) examination on Tuesday.

Nearly 7,389 boys and 7,582 girls from 239 higher secondary schools appeared for the first paper in Tamil language on Tuesday.

Private candidates

As many as 1,317 candidates are taking the Class X examinations as private candidates, the release said.

In Puducherry, a total of 820 examination supervisors and seven flying squads comprising five members in each squad were formed under the supervision of the Chief Education Officer (CEO) to prevent malpractices.

Physically challenged

At least 52 physically challenged students appeared for the examination.

Special seating arrangements were made for these students to take up the examinations.

The exam which began at 9.15 a.m. went on till 12 p.m.

The examination was conducted in 37 centres in Puducherry.

The SSLC examination will go on till April 11.
title: Students sit for SSLC examinations
